meanings.definition: The act of taking risks or being bold.
meanings.sent1: Her darings in the face of danger impressed everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: His darings on the stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's darings to steal nuts from the cat's bowl always ended in a chase.
meanings.sent4: The darings of the tightrope walker left the crowd breathless.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's darings in uncharted territories made history books.

meanings.definition: Plural form of daring, meaning courage or audacity.
meanings.sent1: The darings of the firefighters saved the day.
meanings.sent2: Their darings to speak up against injustice inspired others to do the same.
meanings.sent3: The darings of the little mouse to stand up to the big cat were admirable.
meanings.sent4: The darings of the protesters echoed through the streets.
meanings.sent5: The team's darings to challenge the status quo led to positive change.
